Love this!

Love the fit! Hung perfectly. Have to keep this one I love it so much.
cute! wore to work with black pants a few times

To short for me

snug in the bust but I needed a 3x. still loved this top and so many compliments

great material and great for layering!

I love these jeans. They fit great and I'd totally buy them.

links_reviews_title: My go-to jeans for the month

links_reviews_title: You can't go wrong with Paige Jeans

I was obsessed with these pants. They were the perfect fit and length. I wore them to work a lot and they looked nice. I highly recommend these pants!
The style was cute but the jeans felt a little stretched out making them too loose in the waist to wear.
This cut of me ant is outside my usual go-to’s and it was so fun to play with. Got a lot of comments on how cool they were and how cute my butt looked. The best compliment!

links_reviews_title: Cute, But Size Down (They Stretch Out)
links_reviews_text: These are cute, but stretch to being maybe two sizes too big once worn for an hour. I’m usually a size 27 or 28, but may try these in a 26 or even 25 and just hope the waist isn’t too tight so that the rest of the pants “fit” for the rest of their wear, even if tight for the first hour. Frustrating when things are made without being conscientious of fabric stretch; make the waist bands a little stretchier or larger-than-sized, if the fabric means the stretch will have the sizing be so off? Bummer.
I did not want to give this pants back! They are light weight, stretchy and beyond comfortable. I typically wear a petite so I was nervous about the length but it was perfect!
Perfect fit – super comfortable – dressed up and dressed down. Loved these!
A bit tight in the waist.
Flattering and perfect! Fun color and easy to pair with tops!

Loved these pants but unfortunately a little big. Very soft and great quality though. It's always hard to tell/guess with jeans what size to get. The fabric is very stretchy so these were big on me, especially in the waist. I would size down one.

These are dream. So trendy, SO comfortable... The stretch is great. Made every outfit look modern. Great length. I would have worn them every day if it wasn't the middle of winter. They would be in HEAVY rotation for me in the Spring or Fall. Just a little chilly to show my ankles in the winter, and a little tough to match to boots.
I like the idea of these, I wear a lot of wider leg styles, These were fine but they were too stretchy and kinda rode up.

links_reviews_title: Love them so much I purchased!
links_reviews_text: These are the perfect jeans to dress up or down. I love the high waist and wide leg style. Paige jeans are comfortable and last!

Am considering keeping these pants. Extremely comfortable and extremely cute. They’ve been a staple for me this month. I will say that in some other Paige pants, I’ve been a 27, but those were in corduroys. I sized down for these because of the materials and they were perfect.

Love the look but these DID NOT run large for me. I am a bit curvier and te 29 was definitely tighter on the first try on than expected base on other reviews. The jeans did eventually loosen up but overall they were not the best fit. Aside from that they were very cute, I wore them with and oversized sweater french tucked, tall socks and ankle booties.

links_reviews_title: Never wore it, awkward for short people
links_reviews_text: It's awkward if you're short like me, it hits below the ankles and only looks okay with heels. Never ended up wearing it

links_reviews_title: Super comfy, fit my curvy frame well! Flattering!
links_reviews_text: Great pants that actually fit my large butt and thighs. Was shocked they actually looked great! Got compliments!

These fit great! Their only drawback is they don't have pockets so I found myself trying to stash my phone in them with nowhere to put it. If you are here for fashion only def rent. Very flattering and cute!
Not only do these look good on your tush, but they almost feel like you’re wearing leggings that’s how soft and light they are.
super stylish and great fitting!
Love the stylish design. The jeans are comfy too with a slight stretch.

links_reviews_title: SO cute but know your size
links_reviews_text: I didn't get to wear these but I adore them!! I might size up and order again. They are seriously so trendy and cute, but I should have sized up. If you're like me and in between two sizes, take a humble sip of water and just order the next size up so you don't waste an item lol.
These fit great. They are move of a “fake” denim fabric and really light weight. The fabric looked a little rough. The wash is cute.
Very flattering. Fit perfectly. Wore these a ton with various tops/sweaters and boots.

links_reviews_title: comfy & modern take on a sleek trouser pant
links_reviews_text: Paige can be a strange fit for a big butt/small waist so when I’m between sizes I size up. These stretch a ton and I wish I ordered TTS, but with a belt they’re still flattering without bunching. So comfortable, the details are so cute, elevate any outfit, and really are a HIGH waist. Even though they’re technically cropped they’re really not that short so I wouldn’t recommend for someone shorter —- and def need to be worn with a heel. Overall, obsessed
Extremely flattering, very comfortable, & versatile. I bought these jeans because I loved them so much & wore them so frequently.

I usually find high rise pants really flattering because if there is anything...extra...over my belly, they kind of sucks it in and also make my legs look longer. These did that for the most part, but they were kind of weirder and tighter than necessary over the crotch area which was odd. I still wore them several times over my month, but I don't think I will go with this particular brand of high-waisted pants again.

links_reviews_title: They're Writing Songs of Love (for these jeans), But Not For Me
links_reviews_text: Goodness these jeans look great on other people. I only wish they looked good on my mom bod. Wearing these seemed to create a giant neon pointing arrow to my stomach. It was not a cute look. Add to that the length. These only work in my mind if they are clearly cropped, which they were not on me. Sigh. I didn't wear them out of the house even once.
fits true to size and good quality material. wide leg but not overwhelming on a petite frame.
I’m usually a 6 or 28 in Page jeans. These are real cute but the waist is tight. I would have ordered up a size
Wonderful pant that I'd recommend to anyone. Will warn that they do get wrinkled to the point of looking bad
So. Many. Compliments.

I was super tempted to purchase these pants, but I was kind of worried that I'd wear them too much. They're an interesting rust color, very close to the picture, so they weren't the easiest to style, but their comfort more than made up for that. I was also a teensy bit short for them, but I'm 5'1. They were true to size, if you like your pants not too tight.

This skirt is amazing. The colors are gorgeous irl and the retro style is just so stinkin' cool. Unfortunately, I could barely get it buttoned up and worried the buttons would fly open if I tried to sit down in it. Definitely runs small- unless the sizing is in AU since it's an Australian brand? Either way, I recommend sizing up!

These pants were super comfortable and soft when I tired them on. My only issue was that they seemed to wrinkle easy and they were a bit short for me. I unfortunately wasn't able to wear them as it turned super cold super quick here and my ankles would of been exposed.

links_reviews_title: I added these to my nuuly because I have been a fan of PAIGE denim in the past, nut not a fan of their price tag... I'm rating these a 5: points for chic style, color, construction and comfort. However, these are a little on the large side of a 24 and there is a fair amount of stretch to the material. They are buttery soft but still feel sturdy.
links_reviews_text: The high rise made these fit loosely around the waist but otherwise flattering and a great length to wear with flats or heels. I wore them with a gold blouse and cream leather mules. Will wear them again with a leopard print sweater or a brown suede jacket. I love the way the color can read as a neutral.

Love these and got many compliments. I’m 5’2” so the hem fell right at the top of my foot- cute with heels or flats. They’re super soft so they stretched out after a few wears- I’ll definitely rent them again, but I’ll probably size down.

I loved these pants and got so many compliments. They are so comfortable! I would’ve worn them more or even bought them if they didn’t stretch out so quickly. I don’t think I could’ve sized down though.
These are very cute and well made!
These jeans are so cute. I never wore because they were a bit too small and I should have sized up.

I love Paige jeans and jumped at the opportunity to rent a more funky pair that I wouldn't wear day to day. Super flattering on the bum, great color for fall, cute criss-cross belt loops. Only (miniscule) complaint is that they are a little shorter than the picture makes it seem. The length wasn't too bad on me, but girls who are taller than average beware!
Love them they are very stretchy so I size down to a 25 usually a 26. Fit and color are really nice. I wore with a chunky sweater and wedge sneakers!! So cute!!
These Paige jeans are a great color and fit. They hit at just the right length being on the taller side. Can style so many ways! True to size.

Loved these jeans and was able to dress them up with a blazer and block heels for a biz casual look. Very comfortable and I probably could have gotten away with a size 26 given the stretch, but the 27s worked just fine. Love the higher waist look!
These fit so great. Super comfy and such a nice fall color. I'm 5'2 and they were not a crop AT ALL. But still a great wide leg look.

These fit and are similar to a lot of other pants on the market (high waist, wide leg) but the material felt so thin and stretchy that I didn’t actually want to wear them. I guess I expected a sturdier canvas.

Paige denim doesn't disappoint. The fit was perfect, and I loved the color. They are buttery soft and super comfortable. The length is on the shorter side for someone my height, but I like the more cropped look.
Fit perfectly, stretchy material, loved them!
These ran surprisingly long and I didn't love how stretchy they were. They were comfy but I wish they had more hold to them.
Great color. Comfortable- material has some stretch. I wore to work with flats and out running errands with sneakers.
Very flattering fit, hard to find shoes to wear with them because of the length.
Loved the fit of these jeans - high waist hit me perfectly. Received so many complements and couldn't stop wearing them, so I had to buy!

Great pants for work or play. Wore these a bunch. Would’ve considered buying if they weren’t so trendy. I’m afraid the wide leg style won’t be in next season. Very comfortable, run a little large and stretched out by the end of the day. Would probably rent again.

These were adorable- loved wearing them! Really comfortable material and a great fit. Got a ton of compliments on the color. They wrinkled super easily so I found myself wanting to wear them less frequently compared to some of the other pants I rented.

Loved the style of these. I felt like they stretched out just a little bit after some wear, which made them a little too big in the waist. Had to wear a belt with them. But otherwise, I loved the color and the high waist, and they were super soft and comfortable!

I got so many compliments on these jeans by complete strangers. Not only are they super comfortable (honestly, they are SO soft!), they fit super well. I had been wanting to try a wide-leg look for a while, and I'm so in love with these. They felt maybe a little loose around the waist, but not so much that I didn't wear them several times this month!
Stretch to the denim for a perfect fit!

I rented the copper brown color of these Anessa Jeans and loved them! They were a soft twill and a great year-round weight. They had stretch so they were comfy even though they were high waisted, and they just skimmed my ankle which I love. I definitely plan on renting these again!
Nice and stretchy

These jeans were really soft and super comfortable! My only issue was that they were a bit long on me. Based on the photo, I expected them to be cropped, but they went to my ankles and looked more like bell-bottoms. That said, I ended up really liking the way they looked with high-heeled boots.
They fit amazing!
Fit perfect + super comfy. Lots of compliments and even talked another nuuly friend into getting :) Did stretch a little after first wear, but still able to wear them a second time within the month

It's a fine line between enough stretch that pants fit and so much stretch that they sink into every crease your body holds. I had a hard time finding the right place for them to sit on my hips that didn't create problems in the crotch. They are extremely comfortable, however, and the color is flattering, so I would recommend to other hourglass shapes that typically wear under a size 30.
These are so so cute and flattering. LOVE
These pants are great. Sized down based on the reviews, and the fit was perfect. The length for me was that perfect sweet spot for wide leg pants just above the ankle but not awkwardly short.
Great fit, style, and color. Any top works with this pair of great jeans!

I definitely got a lot of wears in the month I had these pants. They fit well, a little tight through the bum but not suffocating. The wide leg made them super comfy, but still stylish for a night out or work. I basically took them from the office to dinner plans to weekend errands...and just switched up the shoes and top to get a different look...just get them.

Soft fabric and very flattering fit. I Usually struggle to find high-waisted pants that fit since my waist is much smaller than my hips, but these fit me perfectly. The fabric feels very light and soft, so they're also very comfortable to wear.
Love the material, length and fit. A perfect fall pant

After reading the reviews I decided to size down from my usual 28 to a 27 in these jeans. They fit but they rode up a little so I felt like I was constantly pulling them down. If I had gone with a 28 though, they would have been too big in the leg. Overall I like them and I wore them a few times :)
Absolutely loved these jeans! Perfect amount of stretch, fit well for petites. Would order again
These would have fit perfectly if I could have hemmed the legs by like 4 inches. I do have shorter legs though. I did love the fit, makes your bum look good!

I love these pants so much! I wore them with vintage sweaters and got tons of compliments, mainly for the color alone. They fit great, nice wide leg, but not too long. I could wear with sneakers and any flat shoe.

I'm 5'2 and these jeans fit me like more of an ankle pant, but I was totally okay with it. They were still flattering. They run a little big and since there is stretch they were almost a little too big by the end of the day. BUT - perfect for when you want to look cute but also be able to eat a burrito.

Loved these jeans. I'd been wanting to try the cropped flare style and these gave me the opportunity. They have a good amount of stretch, so they were comfy to wear. Maybe stretched a little as I wore them, but I found them to be true to size. Really loved these and may rent again when Im trying to up my pants game
Good amount of stretch, can dress them up or down.

I loved these pants. They were very flattering and the material is really comfortable. I sized up based on the Reviews and I'm very glad I did. They look great with Sweaters and Tee's and Boots and Sneakers.
I wore these a TON. They are so comfy and go with so many things. They also have a bit of a 70s look to them.
This is a great pair of jeans. Sturdy and durable, true to size, great style. There is not anything particularly special in my opinion, but they are nice. I wore a few times, wouldn't purchase,
These high wasted jeans are comfortable and fun!

As others have said these are very long. I'm 5'2'' and they go almost to my ankles. But, with a little heel they are so cute! They fit great everywhere else. They were super comfortable and I wore them often. If they came in black I would keep them!
Such a comfy pant! Not a stiff denim pant at all. Could possibly live in these for the rest of life.
They looked great and were very comfortable. However, they stretched out pretty quickly and have ZERO REAL POCKETS. Did not stop me from wearing them many many times though.

I love these!!! Seriously perfect fit throughout- waist, thighs, butt, etc. They are super soft and stretchy enough to make them extremely comfortable. So many compliments!! I was worried the color would make me look weird since I have tan skin but the color is perfect.
I really wanted to try these as I've been looking for a similar pair. Biggest issue I had was they ran large! Started out well but stretched to the point where I wish I'd gotten a smaller size
I liked the style and color but I did not like that there are no pockets in front or back

I picked these cropped pants anticipating that they would be regular length on me (since I'm petite). I typically wear a 25P, got these in a 25, but should have ordered it in a 24. While I only wore these once, I really loved the wash, the cut, and overall style of these pants. I just wish they were cut for a petite frame!

So many compliments on these jeans. Waist runs true to size, and they’re a flattering high rise. Only call out is they’re a bit roomy in the butt and thigh if you’re not curvy there, otherwise loved wearing these!

links_reviews_title: Wore these 100 times so I bought them!
links_reviews_text: Such a good / comfortable fit. They are really high wasited, well above the belly button for me, so I could wear with crop tops. I tried them with booties to make sure they will transition to fall - so cute! A wardrobe staple.

I liked the style of the jeans, but I didn’t wear them as much as I thought I would. I’m 5’10” and the length was still a little long for where I thought they should hit me. If you’re shorter, they’re probably going to look less like cropped jeans and more like full-length jeans. The jeans are already stretched out from other people wearing them, so I’d size down.

I wanted to love these jeans but they were just a little too big for my frame. In Paige Denim, I am usually a 27 but these were just way too big. I tried to work with them and wear them but I looked a little silly!
LOVE. They fit beautifully and can be worn with everything from a casual T to a dressier blouse. Buttery soft denim, too! Definitely purchasing.
Love how high waisted these jeans fit, fitted through the thigh to give a curvy girl a nice shape. Loved to dress them up with a blouse and some wedges or dresses down with a graphic tee and vans.

If you are between two sizes, go with the larger size because they run pretty tight. They fit me but they definitely squeeze me and give me a slight cameltoe. I can probably wear them for a little while but I can see them getting uncomfortable. I do think these are dressy jeans and they would look good with a bodysuit or anything tight fitting. These are very beautiful and I wish I was able to try the next size

Perfect to wear with a cropped or tucked in shirt! I'm in between a 27 and a 28, and I thought the 28 fit perfectly. If you are in between sizes, I would size up. Also, if you are taller these will be a crop like they are on a model, but at 5'9 they still aren't as short as they appear on model. Overall, I love them and am considering keeping them forever - we'll see!!
This is my second pair of Paige jeans that ran small. I would say size up one waist size for proper fit. I think I finally learned my lesson.
I wanted these to work. I'm 5'6 and hoped these would look more like the pictured model. They fit fine but the length just wasn't right for me. I never wore them.
Jeans fitting is tough! They made my legs look thick, and I felt like I should be on a farm. Hope you have better luck.

These pants checked all the boxes for me. They are high waisted, which is my favorite kind of fit, and the first few times I wore them, I dressed them up with tucked-in blouses or cropped shirts and they looked very nice, but by the end of the month I was wearing them hippie-style with long t-shirts hanging over them, and they also looked great that way. Super comfy material, as well.

links_reviews_title: The pants I didn’t know I needed!
links_reviews_text: I would have never purchased pants this color normally but I am soooo glad I rented them! I love them so much I’m purchasing. The waist is perfectly high and they are incredibly comfortable.
I tried on, but didn't have the opportunity to wear. They just look great on.

Loved these jeans and wore them frequently during the month that I had them: I had been a little bit worried about length because I'm fairly petite, but they hit right at the ankle and the flare was perfect with a cropped sweater or a bodysuit. The material is surprisingly soft; I'd been wearing leggings for three weeks in quarantine, and these were almost as comfortable.

I love, love, loved these jeans! I usually struggle with high waisted jeans that fit my waist and still have enough room for my hips. Whenever I buy jeans I'll usually have to size up and then alter the waistband to fit. But these fit like a (super comfortable) glove! The jean material is so soft and has some stretch to it. It's not as dark as in the photos, it was more of a true medium wash than a medium-dark wash. Might rent them again to buy in the future, but still want to try a few other cropped wide leg jeans before committing to one.

I usually love high-waisted, wide-legged jeans, but these just didn't do it for me. They were a little big, almost as if they were too wide-legged. I felt like I was swimming in fabric. On a positive note, the fabric was very soft, flexible, and comfortable. I work with children and was able to move around and play one ground with the kiddos with no issues while wearing these.

These are super cute! I had a hard time deciding what shoe to wear with them. I eventually went with a platform sneaker, although booties would have worked too. They are pretty stretchy which is nice but also be warned - if you wear it with a tucked in shirt it'll show that unflattering lower ab part in all it's glory.
I bought these pants. I love the color and the high wasted fit.

These were great, but I am 5'1-2 and wish they were slightly more cropped. I would probably hem an inch if I was going to keep them. Great stretch, love how high-waisted they were. Definitely recommend and I will personally order them in another color in the future. I've worn Paige since 2005 or 2006 and it has always been an amazing brand. I got a 25 but may be a 26 in other brands, if that helps you with sizing.
Loved these pants. Definitely were true to size and have a good stretch in them to make you feel comfortable all day long. Would recommend!

I really liked wearing these jeans, the fabric is very soft and they fit true to size. There was enough flare to the legs without feeling too overwhelming. But I am 5'7" and I found the hem hitting several inches above my ankle which felt too short.

Wore to a job interview with booties, very flattering color for my skin tone and loved the wide leg. Was more wide leg than I expected but that's fine. Fit really well on the waist and had a nice stretch.

These pants are so soft and comfortable! I went a size up and they were a good size. The waist was stretchy so I could've gone my normal size I think. The color and fit of these are so perfect and you can dress them up or down.
Good fit but I could have maybe sized down so if you are between sizes I recommend to size down.

I wanted these jeans to be magic, but my hips are a bit too wide and the length was a bit too long for my short height. I will say they had plenty of stretch, so i was able to squeeze into them, but there was a bit of a muffin top on top! I can usually fit into a 28 so maybe I just needed to size up.
This is such a versatile pant. I wore it with rain boots, with flats. It's professional-looking but still comfortable. I got so many compliments whenever I wore it.
In Paige jeans I often size down from my usual 29 to a 28. I did that here and they fit beautifully (but were definitely tight in the bum). Loved wearing these with a short heel, tshirt and blazer.

If you’re even debating renting these...trust me, just do it! They are PERFECT! I wore them so many times I debated buying them, but am currently postpartum and may wait until I’m back to my truest size. So comfy, stylish, and really goes with so much!
Flattering, great length and color

links_reviews_title: Cute style but way too tight
links_reviews_text: These jeans are SO cute. Love the style and weight of denim but the 30 was way too tight. They definitely have stretch but because they are high waisted they were way too tight. I usually wear a 29/30 and if I would have sized up to a 31 they would have been more comfortable.
Very cute. These were tight on me, but I sized down due to availability. Would have been perfect in my normal size. I would order them again.
I am obsessed with these jeans. They are SO comfortable. I could wear them every single day. I knew I had to buy them the second I put them on. I love the style of the jeans with the flare.

Wish it had front pockets- the lack of them here was not flattering with the high rise (might have worked better if the fabric was stiffer). Also, the length was too long on my short legs (that awkward spot between cropped and regular length).
Really loved these, color and material are perfect. Unfortunately the flare just hit too low for my height.

links_reviews_title: The pants I didn’t know I needed
links_reviews_text: These pants fit exactly how I wanted them to! I loved the high waist, and had just enough room in them so that they were incredibly comfy without being too big. The color went with everything — I dressed them up and down — and I really liked the slight flare in the leg. Will likely rent again!

These were great, I'm short so the length is a little odd on me. I wore them with converse for a casual look. Might try them with boots but not sure how it will work. I think they would be really great in summer with sandals. The rise is nice and high and they've got a good amount of stretch. Plus they make my butt look great. Were they not still really expensive I would buy them!
These jeans are amazing!! I normally wear a size 26, but ordered a size 25 based on other reviews. They fit perfectly. Definitely size down.

links_reviews_title: Cute but a bit small in the waist
links_reviews_text: The pants have a lot of stretch so you can get the fitted at the top, wide legged silhouette, but the waist was a bit too small to tuck into wore blouses and booties with heels for days with no meetings in the office. Did not wear them our for fun, which was my plan when picking the style.
A staple of the my work and weekend wardrobe. The material is very soft and comfortable.
Ordered my normal size of jeans but couldn't wear these because the fit was for someone with a shorter torso.

links_reviews_title: Amazing Jeans, super flattering and easy to wear.
links_reviews_text: Well made, well tailored.

Perfect fit (really!), very comfortable fabric (kind of thin), great color (just as shown). Mostly wore with big sweaters and booties. Highly recommend. There are no front pockets, but the back pockets are a nice size.

These pants were awesome! I loved the color and the fit was great. I actually sized one size down and they ended up being the perfect fit. I really liked the length and the wide-leg look as well. Since I'm 5'3" length is always an issue for me, but these were perfect!

For a tall girl, finding any type of “cropped” pants that don’t go up to my shin is a real nightmare. These pants hit perfectly below my ankle and were extremely flattering. I wish they had this pant in other colors!
I wore it to work three times with bright colors. Twice with a tucked in tee and once with a blouse. Loved them.

I loved these pants so much. I would have purchased them if they weren’t so expensive. They are very on trend and flattering. Beautiful and unique color. I got so many compliments on them. They made my booty look good as well. I will rent again and I also want to try the jean version.

These jeans are flattering but be warned, there are no pockets! They're a nice medium-dark wash, true to size, and are a lightweight fabric. Would be great for spring. Just no pockets to stash your phone in!

I loved the style of these pants, and had recently ordered them in burnt orange through Nuuly. I wore a size 29 in the burnt orange fabric, but the denim is definitely tighter. If I were to order them again I would definitely size up to a 30, that way they'd be more comfortable for everyday wear.
I sized one up for some reason, maybe because of the other reviews and I think these are pretty true to size. super cute. I want a different color next time :)
Awesome -- wore a bunch. Soft and comfortable, very easy to style. Love the color.
Soft, so cute and very flattering. A great pair of jeans.

obsessed with these jeans. I've been looking for a wide leg pant for a while and this one did not disappoint. very flatting and structured, yet surprisingly comfortable. honestly i could probably do yoga in these guys no problem. styled with a black knit sweater and wore to work. a bit on the pricey side but i might buy them i love them that much
Loved the cinnamon color. Material was a little thinner than jeans, but I didn't mind. I am a true 6 and they did fit, but could have sized down to a 4 with no issue.

I ordered these in a 24 after reading the reviews but to think the 25 would have been a better fit. I’m petite and can get away with a 24 occasionally but I think I had just a little too much junk in the trunk for these - waist fit great, length was great, fit my thighs fine but they flattened my tush too much and I never wore them. For reference I’m ~5’2 and a pretty curvy 115lbs give or take
I was obsessed with these pants. They were the perfect fit and length. I wore them to work a lot and they looked nice. I highly recommend these pants!
The style was cute but the jeans felt a little stretched out making them too loose in the waist to wear.
This cut of me ant is outside my usual go-to’s and it was so fun to play with. Got a lot of comments on how cool they were and how cute my butt looked. The best compliment!

links_reviews_title: Cute, But Size Down (They Stretch Out)
links_reviews_text: These are cute, but stretch to being maybe two sizes too big once worn for an hour. I’m usually a size 27 or 28, but may try these in a 26 or even 25 and just hope the waist isn’t too tight so that the rest of the pants “fit” for the rest of their wear, even if tight for the first hour. Frustrating when things are made without being conscientious of fabric stretch; make the waist bands a little stretchier or larger-than-sized, if the fabric means the stretch will have the sizing be so off? Bummer.
I did not want to give this pants back! They are light weight, stretchy and beyond comfortable. I typically wear a petite so I was nervous about the length but it was perfect!
Perfect fit – super comfortable – dressed up and dressed down. Loved these!
A bit tight in the waist.
Flattering and perfect! Fun color and easy to pair with tops!

Loved these pants but unfortunately a little big. Very soft and great quality though. It's always hard to tell/guess with jeans what size to get. The fabric is very stretchy so these were big on me, especially in the waist. I would size down one.

These are dream. So trendy, SO comfortable... The stretch is great. Made every outfit look modern. Great length. I would have worn them every day if it wasn't the middle of winter. They would be in HEAVY rotation for me in the Spring or Fall. Just a little chilly to show my ankles in the winter, and a little tough to match to boots.
I like the idea of these, I wear a lot of wider leg styles, These were fine but they were too stretchy and kinda rode up.

links_reviews_title: Love them so much I purchased!
links_reviews_text: These are the perfect jeans to dress up or down. I love the high waist and wide leg style. Paige jeans are comfortable and last!

Am considering keeping these pants. Extremely comfortable and extremely cute. They’ve been a staple for me this month. I will say that in some other Paige pants, I’ve been a 27, but those were in corduroys. I sized down for these because of the materials and they were perfect.

Love the look but these DID NOT run large for me. I am a bit curvier and te 29 was definitely tighter on the first try on than expected base on other reviews. The jeans did eventually loosen up but overall they were not the best fit. Aside from that they were very cute, I wore them with and oversized sweater french tucked, tall socks and ankle booties.

links_reviews_title: Never wore it, awkward for short people
links_reviews_text: It's awkward if you're short like me, it hits below the ankles and only looks okay with heels. Never ended up wearing it

links_reviews_title: Super comfy, fit my curvy frame well! Flattering!
links_reviews_text: Great pants that actually fit my large butt and thighs. Was shocked they actually looked great! Got compliments!

These fit great! Their only drawback is they don't have pockets so I found myself trying to stash my phone in them with nowhere to put it. If you are here for fashion only def rent. Very flattering and cute!
Not only do these look good on your tush, but they almost feel like you’re wearing leggings that’s how soft and light they are.
super stylish and great fitting!
Love the stylish design. The jeans are comfy too with a slight stretch.

links_reviews_title: SO cute but know your size
links_reviews_text: I didn't get to wear these but I adore them!! I might size up and order again. They are seriously so trendy and cute, but I should have sized up. If you're like me and in between two sizes, take a humble sip of water and just order the next size up so you don't waste an item lol.
These fit great. They are move of a “fake” denim fabric and really light weight. The fabric looked a little rough. The wash is cute.
Very flattering. Fit perfectly. Wore these a ton with various tops/sweaters and boots.

links_reviews_title: comfy & modern take on a sleek trouser pant
links_reviews_text: Paige can be a strange fit for a big butt/small waist so when I’m between sizes I size up. These stretch a ton and I wish I ordered TTS, but with a belt they’re still flattering without bunching. So comfortable, the details are so cute, elevate any outfit, and really are a HIGH waist. Even though they’re technically cropped they’re really not that short so I wouldn’t recommend for someone shorter —- and def need to be worn with a heel. Overall, obsessed
Extremely flattering, very comfortable, & versatile. I bought these jeans because I loved them so much & wore them so frequently.

I usually find high rise pants really flattering because if there is anything...extra...over my belly, they kind of sucks it in and also make my legs look longer. These did that for the most part, but they were kind of weirder and tighter than necessary over the crotch area which was odd. I still wore them several times over my month, but I don't think I will go with this particular brand of high-waisted pants again.

links_reviews_title: They're Writing Songs of Love (for these jeans), But Not For Me
links_reviews_text: Goodness these jeans look great on other people. I only wish they looked good on my mom bod. Wearing these seemed to create a giant neon pointing arrow to my stomach. It was not a cute look. Add to that the length. These only work in my mind if they are clearly cropped, which they were not on me. Sigh. I didn't wear them out of the house even once.
fits true to size and good quality material. wide leg but not overwhelming on a petite frame.
I’m usually a 6 or 28 in Page jeans. These are real cute but the waist is tight. I would have ordered up a size
Wonderful pant that I'd recommend to anyone. Will warn that they do get wrinkled to the point of looking bad
So. Many. Compliments.

I was super tempted to purchase these pants, but I was kind of worried that I'd wear them too much. They're an interesting rust color, very close to the picture, so they weren't the easiest to style, but their comfort more than made up for that. I was also a teensy bit short for them, but I'm 5'1. They were true to size, if you like your pants not too tight.

This skirt is amazing. The colors are gorgeous irl and the retro style is just so stinkin' cool. Unfortunately, I could barely get it buttoned up and worried the buttons would fly open if I tried to sit down in it. Definitely runs small- unless the sizing is in AU since it's an Australian brand? Either way, I recommend sizing up!

These pants were super comfortable and soft when I tired them on. My only issue was that they seemed to wrinkle easy and they were a bit short for me. I unfortunately wasn't able to wear them as it turned super cold super quick here and my ankles would of been exposed.

links_reviews_title: I added these to my nuuly because I have been a fan of PAIGE denim in the past, nut not a fan of their price tag... I'm rating these a 5: points for chic style, color, construction and comfort. However, these are a little on the large side of a 24 and there is a fair amount of stretch to the material. They are buttery soft but still feel sturdy.
links_reviews_text: The high rise made these fit loosely around the waist but otherwise flattering and a great length to wear with flats or heels. I wore them with a gold blouse and cream leather mules. Will wear them again with a leopard print sweater or a brown suede jacket. I love the way the color can read as a neutral.

Love these and got many compliments. I’m 5’2” so the hem fell right at the top of my foot- cute with heels or flats. They’re super soft so they stretched out after a few wears- I’ll definitely rent them again, but I’ll probably size down.

I loved these pants and got so many compliments. They are so comfortable! I would’ve worn them more or even bought them if they didn’t stretch out so quickly. I don’t think I could’ve sized down though.
These are very cute and well made!
These jeans are so cute. I never wore because they were a bit too small and I should have sized up.

I love Paige jeans and jumped at the opportunity to rent a more funky pair that I wouldn't wear day to day. Super flattering on the bum, great color for fall, cute criss-cross belt loops. Only (miniscule) complaint is that they are a little shorter than the picture makes it seem. The length wasn't too bad on me, but girls who are taller than average beware!
Love them they are very stretchy so I size down to a 25 usually a 26. Fit and color are really nice. I wore with a chunky sweater and wedge sneakers!! So cute!!
These Paige jeans are a great color and fit. They hit at just the right length being on the taller side. Can style so many ways! True to size.

Loved these jeans and was able to dress them up with a blazer and block heels for a biz casual look. Very comfortable and I probably could have gotten away with a size 26 given the stretch, but the 27s worked just fine. Love the higher waist look!
These fit so great. Super comfy and such a nice fall color. I'm 5'2 and they were not a crop AT ALL. But still a great wide leg look.

These fit and are similar to a lot of other pants on the market (high waist, wide leg) but the material felt so thin and stretchy that I didn’t actually want to wear them. I guess I expected a sturdier canvas.

Paige denim doesn't disappoint. The fit was perfect, and I loved the color. They are buttery soft and super comfortable. The length is on the shorter side for someone my height, but I like the more cropped look.
Fit perfectly, stretchy material, loved them!
These ran surprisingly long and I didn't love how stretchy they were. They were comfy but I wish they had more hold to them.
Great color. Comfortable- material has some stretch. I wore to work with flats and out running errands with sneakers.
Very flattering fit, hard to find shoes to wear with them because of the length.
Loved the fit of these jeans - high waist hit me perfectly. Received so many complements and couldn't stop wearing them, so I had to buy!

Great pants for work or play. Wore these a bunch. Would’ve considered buying if they weren’t so trendy. I’m afraid the wide leg style won’t be in next season. Very comfortable, run a little large and stretched out by the end of the day. Would probably rent again.

These were adorable- loved wearing them! Really comfortable material and a great fit. Got a ton of compliments on the color. They wrinkled super easily so I found myself wanting to wear them less frequently compared to some of the other pants I rented.

Loved the style of these. I felt like they stretched out just a little bit after some wear, which made them a little too big in the waist. Had to wear a belt with them. But otherwise, I loved the color and the high waist, and they were super soft and comfortable!

I got so many compliments on these jeans by complete strangers. Not only are they super comfortable (honestly, they are SO soft!), they fit super well. I had been wanting to try a wide-leg look for a while, and I'm so in love with these. They felt maybe a little loose around the waist, but not so much that I didn't wear them several times this month!
Stretch to the denim for a perfect fit!

I rented the copper brown color of these Anessa Jeans and loved them! They were a soft twill and a great year-round weight. They had stretch so they were comfy even though they were high waisted, and they just skimmed my ankle which I love. I definitely plan on renting these again!
Nice and stretchy

These jeans were really soft and super comfortable! My only issue was that they were a bit long on me. Based on the photo, I expected them to be cropped, but they went to my ankles and looked more like bell-bottoms. That said, I ended up really liking the way they looked with high-heeled boots.
They fit amazing!
Fit perfect + super comfy. Lots of compliments and even talked another nuuly friend into getting :) Did stretch a little after first wear, but still able to wear them a second time within the month

It's a fine line between enough stretch that pants fit and so much stretch that they sink into every crease your body holds. I had a hard time finding the right place for them to sit on my hips that didn't create problems in the crotch. They are extremely comfortable, however, and the color is flattering, so I would recommend to other hourglass shapes that typically wear under a size 30.
These are so so cute and flattering. LOVE
These pants are great. Sized down based on the reviews, and the fit was perfect. The length for me was that perfect sweet spot for wide leg pants just above the ankle but not awkwardly short.
Great fit, style, and color. Any top works with this pair of great jeans!

I definitely got a lot of wears in the month I had these pants. They fit well, a little tight through the bum but not suffocating. The wide leg made them super comfy, but still stylish for a night out or work. I basically took them from the office to dinner plans to weekend errands...and just switched up the shoes and top to get a different look...just get them.

Soft fabric and very flattering fit. I Usually struggle to find high-waisted pants that fit since my waist is much smaller than my hips, but these fit me perfectly. The fabric feels very light and soft, so they're also very comfortable to wear.
Love the material, length and fit. A perfect fall pant

After reading the reviews I decided to size down from my usual 28 to a 27 in these jeans. They fit but they rode up a little so I felt like I was constantly pulling them down. If I had gone with a 28 though, they would have been too big in the leg. Overall I like them and I wore them a few times :)
Absolutely loved these jeans! Perfect amount of stretch, fit well for petites. Would order again
These would have fit perfectly if I could have hemmed the legs by like 4 inches. I do have shorter legs though. I did love the fit, makes your bum look good!

I love these pants so much! I wore them with vintage sweaters and got tons of compliments, mainly for the color alone. They fit great, nice wide leg, but not too long. I could wear with sneakers and any flat shoe.

I'm 5'2 and these jeans fit me like more of an ankle pant, but I was totally okay with it. They were still flattering. They run a little big and since there is stretch they were almost a little too big by the end of the day. BUT - perfect for when you want to look cute but also be able to eat a burrito.

Loved these jeans. I'd been wanting to try the cropped flare style and these gave me the opportunity. They have a good amount of stretch, so they were comfy to wear. Maybe stretched a little as I wore them, but I found them to be true to size. Really loved these and may rent again when Im trying to up my pants game
Good amount of stretch, can dress them up or down.

I loved these pants. They were very flattering and the material is really comfortable. I sized up based on the Reviews and I'm very glad I did. They look great with Sweaters and Tee's and Boots and Sneakers.
I wore these a TON. They are so comfy and go with so many things. They also have a bit of a 70s look to them.
This is a great pair of jeans. Sturdy and durable, true to size, great style. There is not anything particularly special in my opinion, but they are nice. I wore a few times, wouldn't purchase,
These high wasted jeans are comfortable and fun!

As others have said these are very long. I'm 5'2'' and they go almost to my ankles. But, with a little heel they are so cute! They fit great everywhere else. They were super comfortable and I wore them often. If they came in black I would keep them!
Such a comfy pant! Not a stiff denim pant at all. Could possibly live in these for the rest of life.
They looked great and were very comfortable. However, they stretched out pretty quickly and have ZERO REAL POCKETS. Did not stop me from wearing them many many times though.

I love these!!! Seriously perfect fit throughout- waist, thighs, butt, etc. They are super soft and stretchy enough to make them extremely comfortable. So many compliments!! I was worried the color would make me look weird since I have tan skin but the color is perfect.
I really wanted to try these as I've been looking for a similar pair. Biggest issue I had was they ran large! Started out well but stretched to the point where I wish I'd gotten a smaller size
I liked the style and color but I did not like that there are no pockets in front or back

I picked these cropped pants anticipating that they would be regular length on me (since I'm petite). I typically wear a 25P, got these in a 25, but should have ordered it in a 24. While I only wore these once, I really loved the wash, the cut, and overall style of these pants. I just wish they were cut for a petite frame!

So many compliments on these jeans. Waist runs true to size, and they’re a flattering high rise. Only call out is they’re a bit roomy in the butt and thigh if you’re not curvy there, otherwise loved wearing these!

links_reviews_title: Wore these 100 times so I bought them!
links_reviews_text: Such a good / comfortable fit. They are really high wasited, well above the belly button for me, so I could wear with crop tops. I tried them with booties to make sure they will transition to fall - so cute! A wardrobe staple.

I liked the style of the jeans, but I didn’t wear them as much as I thought I would. I’m 5’10” and the length was still a little long for where I thought they should hit me. If you’re shorter, they’re probably going to look less like cropped jeans and more like full-length jeans. The jeans are already stretched out from other people wearing them, so I’d size down.

I wanted to love these jeans but they were just a little too big for my frame. In Paige Denim, I am usually a 27 but these were just way too big. I tried to work with them and wear them but I looked a little silly!
LOVE. They fit beautifully and can be worn with everything from a casual T to a dressier blouse. Buttery soft denim, too! Definitely purchasing.
Love how high waisted these jeans fit, fitted through the thigh to give a curvy girl a nice shape. Loved to dress them up with a blouse and some wedges or dresses down with a graphic tee and vans.

If you are between two sizes, go with the larger size because they run pretty tight. They fit me but they definitely squeeze me and give me a slight cameltoe. I can probably wear them for a little while but I can see them getting uncomfortable. I do think these are dressy jeans and they would look good with a bodysuit or anything tight fitting. These are very beautiful and I wish I was able to try the next size

Perfect to wear with a cropped or tucked in shirt! I'm in between a 27 and a 28, and I thought the 28 fit perfectly. If you are in between sizes, I would size up. Also, if you are taller these will be a crop like they are on a model, but at 5'9 they still aren't as short as they appear on model. Overall, I love them and am considering keeping them forever - we'll see!!

i have small boobs so this fit weirdly at the chest, there was still a lot of space between the fabric so that was frustrating. other than that it was fun to wear. probably works better on someone with bigger boobs and taller.
This dress seemed to run a little small and fit oddly in the chest area. I rented it for a work holiday party but didn't end up wearing. Green is a little bright than I imagined it.

links_reviews_title: Cute dress but didn't fit me
links_reviews_text: This dress ended up being a little too short and too tight around my rib cage area, so I'd say it runs a little bit small.

Wore this dress for a Christmas party - absolutely loved it! Saw a few of the reviews that it ran a bit small. I'm usually a small or medium in dresses and the medium fit perfectly, without being too tight across the chest (the area I was most worried about). Fabric is gorgeous!

Wore this dress to a fancy Christmas party and it was great! One downside is that I'm very small chested and while it didn't show anything, I had to use double-sided tape to make it a bit more modest. Great dress though, got tons of compliments!

I did love this dress but I'm thicker through the middle so it was VERY tight when zipped up at the empire waist. I don't think I could have sized up though b/c would have been to big in the bust & shoulders?? I think?? Very cute though & sad I didn't get to wear, just thought I would be too uncomfortable at a party all night!

Loved this dress. It’s so perfect for Christmas and has very nice details like the sleeve pleats and lace. Not sure I’d wear this anytime but the couple of weeks leading up to Christmas but it was very flattering and got lots of compliments. I wore with a leather jacket and over the knee boots. Usually wear a small but got the medium based on reviews. I think either would’ve worked, but if you have bigger boobs I’d size up for comfort.

links_reviews_title: Super cute! It didn’t fit me but it fit my daughter
links_reviews_text: My daughter wore it to a Christmas party.

This dress was very cute and flattering. I'm generally a size 8 and the large fit fine. It's a little low cut so finding the right bra was tricky. My only complaint was that because of a few snags in the lace, I just felt like I was wearing a used dress.
The bust didn't fit quite right (perhaps was sized for a larger person??) so I never ended up wearing it. Would've made a great holiday party dress though!
So in love with the green and lace. Alas, I could not zip this dress up! Sizing up and going to try again for my next order. Would love to wear this for a holiday party!

Even though I wa so excited about this and it did not fit me I’m still giving this five stars. Very beautiful and well made dress to wear to a fancy occasion or just to get dressy on a Tuesday. When I tried this on it was way too short which was so upsetting but when I pulled it out of the box I had a feeling it wouldn’t have fit me. I know my body type and this just wasn’t it for me.

Our library hosted an Emerald anniversary event. I threw this dress in and another green one as options. This dress fit perfectly! I am 5'2", 115 lbs, 32D for reference. The mixture of lace and satin ruffles were lovely. I received many compliments throughout the evening for the gorgeous color and unique style. I wore it with a pair of flat knee-high leather boots.

I only wore this dress once, but it felt quite pretty and didn't require too much accessorizing with all the lace and patterning (read: easy!). This is an item that I ogled online, I expected to wear it the most, but once it actually arrived my desire for it waned—really great reason to use Nuuly, as I could wear once and return!

links_reviews_title: Not the best for petite frames
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love this, but I usually need adjustable straps because I’m tiny. Since the straps weren’t adjustable, I couldn’t find a way to wear this dress. The straps just kept falling off my shoulders. Wouldn’t recommend for petite, small chested people.

links_reviews_title: Straps too long and not adjustable
links_reviews_text: Would have been cute if the straps weren’t double the length they needed to be!

This would have been a keeper if the neckline wasn't so dramatically low. Not daytime appropriate. You can't wear a bra with this dress and the straps aren't adjustable. Nice blush color and thick, soft material that isn't see-through (a problem I encounter w most comparable dresses). If you don't mind cleavage, grab a leather jacket and try this on for a sexy look.
So fun and comfy and the cit is perfect. Didn't wanna take to off.
Bought this dress! The straps were a little long but I might get them hemmed. I have a slender build and the XS fit perfectly. 110 pounds, 5'5.

This dress was perfect for a stylish yet comfortable day/evening. The material is thinner than expected so it was great for hot days. I actually wore it with a black sweater over top and black ankle boots in the colder temps. It was a versatile dress.
This was way too large and i did not end up wearing it at all. Definitely need to size down, however i was also not impressed with the material.

links_reviews_title: Cute dress, but definitely had some flaws. The biggest issue for me was that the stomach area was oddly baggy, which made it look like I have belly pooch. Super odd. The straps were also way too long. Could potentially be cute with a large sweater thrown on top, so it seems more like a skirt
links_reviews_text: I wore this for Valentine’s dinner, so it was okay that it was a bit revealing on top. I wore it with black booties.
I was expecting something more lux. It was a nice day look but nothing special. Prob would have passed if I knew the quality/feel
I wore this dress with a long black cardigan and black heels for a much needed date night out. It felt fun without trying too hard.

I was really excited about this dress, but the cut just did not hit right on my body. Between the straps being quite long and the area cut for the butt being low, this just wasn't flattering, and I couldn't even make it work with a belt. I'm 5'9", 140 lbs, athletic build and usually a 4-6 for reference.

Thie dress doesnt give much in the midsection. I am very fit and don't have any extra weight in my stomach section but I felt stuck in this dress. Like if I had a glass of water it wouldn't fit. I got a size small, which is my standard size but i would size up next time
Overall a cute dress. Paired it with a cropped sweater and got multiple compliments on it. Only complaint is that it had excess material in the stomach area making it look a little frumpy at times.

As all the other reviews stated, this dress is super awkward. The straps are too long and create a droopy effect. The hips are too tight so it feels awkward to move in. Even with a sweater on top, I couldn’t make it work unfortunately
I wish the straps were adjustable. They are slightly too long and the chest area gets bunchy.

This one definitely has a few flaws, but I still felt like a million bucks in it! Got tons of compliments. Like the other reviews say, the straps are definitely too long, but I just went with it. The fabric isn’t super forgiving, but spanx helped with that. Considered buying it, but I’ll probably just rent again in the spring.

links_reviews_title: Should have listened to other reviewers
links_reviews_text: I really liked the idea of this dress, but as other reviewers said, the straps were way too long and not adjustable. I also wasn't super comfortable with how tight fitting it was.
Fits perfect!

links_reviews_title: So cute and easy! Straps a little long.
links_reviews_text: Wore this to work with a black cropped A Piece Apart sweater over it. With black cowboy boots and red socks, for a pop of color. The straps are a little long, but I'm also pretty flat chested, so there's that...also liked that it was cotton instead of satin / silk like most slip dresses.

My most worn item in my whole Nuuly order! Such a cute and fun dress and perfect length. It is low-key sexy and perfect for a bar with a leather jacket (or going out to dinner). The straps are what frustrated me the most because they were too long and not adjustable (I had to wear a bra-lette underneath). This didn't stop me from wearing it though! Hugged the stomach slightly and the material is thin so I wore spanx.

I’m 140 and 34DD and had to get the L bc the M wasn’t available. It’s a bit big but cinched with a belt or with a knotted tee on top will work. I’m 5’8” and the neckline was obscene, so definitely requires the above modifications for me plus tying the straps in a little knot. Will be cute now with sneakers running errands around town!
This print is fun but the straps were too long and don’t adjust.
Dress was cute, nice cut
Everything was great besides the straps. They're not adjustable so it fell down alot.

I thought this dress was really pretty, but the straps are soooo long. I'm 5'10 and they were at least two inches long on me. That said, if you're shorter, you could maybe work some magic to tie the straps into a racer-back, but that's kind of a pain. Also, I thought it would be more satiny/shiny, but it's actually flat and made of rayon. I liked that, but didn't think it was obvious in the pics.

While the print and material was beautiful, I should have listened to the other reviews about the straps. They’re way too long! Was planning on wearing with a pullover sweater, but you could see through to my whole bra poking out under the dress. Straps aren’t adjustable, so you would have to be really tall and small chested to make this dress work.

I love the print! I am busty and when I tried it on I would have liked if it would’ve had adjustable straps. I decided to layer with a new top underneath and a black sweater on top with some booties was really cute and comfortable and fabric is soft. It is lightweight but not so transparent that you need a slip underneath.

links_reviews_title: Didn’t like as much as expected
links_reviews_text: As others mentioned, the straps are not adjustable and hits at a weird spot on the chest for short people. Constantly adjusting. Great piece to layer with long sweater for fall.
loved this dress - nice alternative to a satin/silk slip dress. easily dressed up or down.

links_reviews_title: Fun but tough fit on me
links_reviews_text: Super cute but tight around the hips if you're a little curvier. Really low as well so ended up being a little sexier than planned.

Wore this one and got compliments everywhere I went that day. Fit like a glove. Just enough skin to be sexy without being over the top. Can't wait to wear it into fall with a denim jacket. Love this dress.

This dress is perfect for layering from fall into the colder weather. I live in Georgia so I layered a tank top over it to feel like fall when its still 90 degrees in September. I can't wait to rock it with boots and a chunky sweater. The neckline is rather low, but looks great on a small bust, just not at work. I think it would be a tough style to wear with a large bust. You can see black undergarments thru it, but that is an easy fix as its not meant for any kind of bra. I will be purchasing this. I got two compliments in the first 20 minutes of wearing it. One from boyfriend who follows no trends and the other from a girl half my age with mad style. WIN!
Loved it, might buy it!
Not easily workable. Would've been good if only the straps were adjustable.
Beautiful, fun, comfy, nice fit

I basically lived in this dress the whole month, so much so that I decided to buy it when my 30 days were up. I was never sure if I could rock the slip dress style but this was loose enough that I felt confident even on my softest days while also hitting in all the right spots so was super flattering. I wore it solo, with one of the vintage camo jackets I rented over it, with a white oversized tee knotted & a denim jacket & sneakers, and also with a black tee over knotted with black boots & rancher hat. It has so many looks in one dress. It also feels like you are wearing nothing at all & is super breezy so had been great for these super hot end of summer days. I am also a stylist & have worn it on shoot days & it is long enough & has enough move around room that I can bend over & squat down when I need to pin. Recommended for every body!
This dress was so cute. It ran a little long on me, but once I styled it with a belt and platform boots it was perfect. Runs long and narrow.
such a fun color, comfy and so cute with jeans! obsessed.

I am usually a L or XL in this style and definitely needed the XL. Runs narrow through the hips. Biggest issue for me was the straps were way too long and they aren’t adjustable. Showed way too much cleavage for my comfort - would have had to have the straps shortened.

A large was perfect for me since I wanted it to be loose like a shift dress but it wasn't TOO loose. The back is deep so you will need a special bra for backless dresses. The neckline was deep too - I found it was a bit too sexy for work. It was think and light, perfect or summer, but not sheer at all.
large in the straps - very long in chest area
Love this dress! Love the length and the fit! The quality is amazing too. I wore it with a cardigan on top, but next time I’ll wear it with a white t shirt under. What a look 🙌🏼😍
Like the other reviewers stated, the straps on this dress are extremely long. I had to use a pin the tie them together in the back so that I didn’t flash people!
Very odd fit for a short person. The straps are long and not adjustable so it essentially hung past my boobs in the front. Probably a better fit for a taller person.
Fits as expected. Runs narrow in hips
My only complaint is I wish the straps were adjustable!
I sized up to be safe based on some reviews and the 31 was too big (I'm normally a 29/30). Still was a great pair of pants, I'll be renting again in a smaller size!

I lived in these for a month. My normal size ranges from 26-27 depending on the brand. The 26 in these fit like a glove (in the best way). The rise is higher than many high-rise jeans, which I loved given the trouser leg was pretty billowy. Buttery soft. I found myself reaching for these over leggings on several occasions to sit in my home office all day.
perfecttt

I love Citizens jeans so much and I was really hoping these would work, but unfortunately they just aren't for people with my body type. I have thighs on the thicker side, so the fabric was not loose, therefore not giving the really cute, relaxed fit shown on the model. I really want to find the perfect pair of high waisted, cropped, relaxed pants, but unfortunately I haven't found any that don't squeeze my thighs!

I absolutely loved these pants but the fit is very different after you wear for an hour. The 31 fit like a glove at first, then stretch out to be very loose. I felt like an early 00s kid but they were very flattering oddly enough. I would rent again but order a size down to keep the highwaisted look on the model.

links_reviews_title: I thought it was way awkward, but everyone else loved it!
links_reviews_text: Like previous reviews, the waist felt super frumpy and awkward. I have a really long torso and flat tummy, but the waist (though it felt true to size—I ordered a MP) would slowly slip down and leave a wonky looking bulge. This bulge was accentuated by the odd little tassel hanging down in front—that served no functional purpose and only drew further attention to the awkwardness of the waist bulge situation. Maybe, MAAAAAAAYBE, sizing down would have helped, but again, the size felt right. (With that silky, slippery fabric, what the skirt really needs is a drawstring to hold it in place!) Here’s how I made it “work...ish”: I decided to tie the little tassel thing into a loose bow, and I wore the skirt backwards! This helped immensely. I wore it high on my waist with a black, flowy, silk button down, tucked in all the way, with black clogs. The petit length was perfect for my long torso and short legs. And surprisingly, even though I thought the whole get up was pretty “meh,” I received so.many.freaking.compliments. One gorgeous young thing (I’m 38, she was probably 22 or 23)—who clearly has an eye for fashion—literally chased me down the street to catch up with me and tell me how “totally obsessed” she was with my outfit and specifically the skirt. “Like, where did you get that?! I have to have it!” So maybe it feels weirder than it actually looks? Though, I will say, if you’ve got a short torso, I just cannot imagine you being able to make this work well for you. Hope this weird review is at least somewhat helpful. Ha! It’s a tough piece to explain/review!
